---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9266514273/job/25490915213)

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9266514273/job/25490914907)
This looks great to me! I've left some comments on both this and #9433 .
This looks great to me! I've left some comments on both this and #9433 .
Why not `F : Type v`? Are there definitely no results which use both R and F here?
Oops, thanks!
Do you think `IsOnCurve` would be a better name for this definition than `Equation`? Maybe that's not in scope for this PR...

Sure, I plan to rehaul both `Equation` and `Nonsingular` in a separate future PR. Their names are not ideal (e.g. I think `Nonsingular` should be `IsNonsingular` according to style conventions), and their definitions can be generalised to be correct over more rings (e.g. PIDs).

```suggestion
  simp only [equation_iff, Affine.equation_iff', fin3_def_ext, one_pow, mul_one]
```
`congr!` doesn't seem to be needed.
Thanks!

I think `IsNonsingular` is a better name for this but again this might not be for this PR. It's probably also the wrong definition for a general ring: one should instead probably ask that the evaluations are units rather than nonzero. Is this an issue?
Oops, I didn't see this message before I typed the other one.

Not that it's useful for anything, but I just want to remark that this lemma (and seemingly all lemmas about `![Y ^ 2, Y ^ 3, 0]`) are removed without replacement.

I've also observed [another Jacobian lemma](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13846/files#diff-fbad8e13903b8830a3972d6559954956a0838eb9c5729196639611aa39e181b6R404-R408) removed for no reason and I'm adding it back.

It's not fully removed - it's combined into the proof of `WeierstrassCurve.Jacobian.dblU_ne_zero_of_Y_eq`, and I don't see the use of this anymore. I don't mind adding it back somewhere, but do reuse it in the proof.
